source.sqlReaderQuery:
SELECT TOP 10 [PersonID]
      ,[Name]
      ,[LastModifytime]
  FROM [dbo].[data_source_table]
  ORDER BY LastModifytime DESC

properties.description:
Run a simple ETL job using Azure Databricks, with a single pane of glass monitoring from ADF.

In the template, we check for source dataset availability. Once it is available we copy it into a blob storage for staging using a Copy activity. The same storage is accessed from Databricks clusters while processing the data (ETL). The output is stored in the same storage under 'output' folder. Various notebook properties are referenced as expressions using pipeline parameters, which lets you configure more generic and reusable pipelines. 
 
For steps on setting up storage and databricks notebook refer https://aka.ms/databricks-instructions.

activities.name: Availability flag
activities.description:
Lookup (or Get Metadata) activity is used to get information about the source files if they are available for processing. 
In this template, only when the '_success' flag/ file is available at source, would the downstream activities be triggered.

activities.name: file-to-blob
activities.description: Copy activity copies the actual files/ dataset to be processed by Databricks into a staging store. This storage should be accessible by the Azure Databricks cluster referenced in the next activity.

activities.name: ETL
activities.description: Databricks Notebook activity does the processing of the data copied in the previous step (copy activity). Please ensure you have added the databricks notebook (https://adflabstaging1.blob.core.windows.net/share/Transformations.html) in the databricks work-space and referenced it in the notebook activity in ADF.

source.sqlReaderQuery: select MAX(LastModifytime) as NewWatermarkvalue from data_source_table

sqlReaderQuery.value: select * from data_source_table where LastModifytime > '@{activity('LookupOldWaterMarkActivity').output.firstRow.WatermarkValue}' and LastModifytime <= '@{activity('LookupNewWaterMarkActivity').output.firstRow.NewWatermarkvalue}'

source.sqlReaderQuery: CREATE CLUSTERED COLUMNSTORE INDEX cci_FactOrder ON [Fact].[Order]

SELECT LoadDataMap
FROM dbo._intelex_object
WHERE ObjectName = 'Audits_AssessmentObject'

properties.description: Sample demo data flow to convert currencies

transformations.name: NewCurrencyColumn
transformations.description: Create a new calculated column from currency rate

transformations.name: ConditionalSplit1
transformations.description: Split the data on state to create 2 streams

typeProperties.script:
source(output(
		Column_1 as string,
		Column_2 as string,
		Column_3 as string,
		Column_4 as string
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: false,
	validateSchema: false,
	ignoreNoFilesFound: false) ~> USDCurrency
source(output(
		PreviousConversionRate as double,
		Country as string,
		DateTime1 as string,
		CurrentConversionRate as double
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	ignoreNoFilesFound: false) ~> CADSource
USDCurrency, CADSource union(byName: true)~> Union
Union derive(NewCurrencyRate = round(CurrentConversionRate*1.25)) ~> NewCurrencyColumn
NewCurrencyColumn split(Country == 'USD',
	Country == 'CAD',
	disjoint: false) ~> ConditionalSplit1@(USD, CAD)
ConditionalSplit1@USD sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false) ~> USDSink
ConditionalSplit1@CAD sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false) ~> CADSink

parameters{
	OutputFileName as string
}
source(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	ignoreNoFilesFound: false,
	inferDriftedColumnTypes: true) ~> AzureBlobDB2Source
DB224Time derive(each(match(type=='string'), $$ = regexReplace($$, `(\d+)\.(\d+)\.(\d+)`, '$1:$2:$3'))) ~> Db2ToSQLDateFormat
DB224TimeStamp derive(each(match(type=='string'), $$ = regexReplace($$, `(\-)(\d+)\.(\d+)\.(\d+)`, ' $2:$3:$4'))) ~> Db2ToSQLTimestamp
AzureBlobDB2Source derive(each(match(type=='string'), $$ = regexReplace($$, `(\\d+\\-\\d+\\-\\d+)\\-24\\.00\\.00\\.000000`, '$1 23:59:59:999999'))) ~> DB224TimeStamp
Db2ToSQLTimestamp derive(each(match(type=='string'), $$ = regexReplace($$, `(24\\.00\\.00`, '23:59:59.999999'))) ~> DB224Time
Db2ToSQLDateFormat sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	partitionFileNames:[($OutputFileName)],
	partitionBy('hash', 1),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true,
	quoteAll: true) ~> AzureBlobDB2DateFixed

source(output(
		{_col0_} as string,
		{_col1_} as integer,
		{_col2_} as string,
		{_col3_} as string,
		{_col4_} as date,
		{_col5_} as string
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	ignoreNoFilesFound: false,
	inferDriftedColumnTypes: true) ~> AzureBlobDB2Export
AzureBlobDB2Export derive({_col5_} = regexReplace({_col5_}, '(\\d+).(\\d+).(\\d+)', '$1:$2:$3')) ~> DerivedColumn1
DerivedColumn1 sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	partitionFileNames:['APPOINTMENT_ZONE.DAT'],
	partitionBy('hash', 1),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> sink1
